title: Crysis
notes:
- Say yes and agree to everything on install (Comrade, .NET) even if it fails.
- "noesync" launch option to fix videos.
- Spam [PLAY >> COPY KEY >> "OKAY" license" >> PLAY >> ...] over and over until it launches. (Sets in eventually.) 
- Steam overlay is clickable after game gets cursor.

title: Crysis
notes: Can't activate

title: Crysis
notes: Needed to add "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" variable to Crysis startup options. After that, game runs perfect. Also, if you're using KDE (maybe other DE too) remember to disable desktop effects, because it seems that Windows games  itself doesn't trigger 'disable desktop effects action'. This causes FPS drops.

title: Crysis
notes: work without issue (3 hours play). don't use proton 3.7.4-beta(it crash often with it)

title: Crysis
notes: I needed to add "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" variable to Crysis startup options. Doesn't work with proton version: 3.7-5.

On first play accepted all install prompts including the failures.

Set the following in the steam game launch options PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%

Tried using the contents of Crysis Warhead 64bit Bin64 folder after copying to Crysis steam folder, renaming the folder to Bin64 and renaming Crysis64.exe to Crysis.exe. The game starts and can configure the settings etc on menus. On starting a new game the pre-intro video plays but the ingame cinematic does not play. You have to kill the game. After putting the original Crysis Bin32 back. The game ran fine (with  stutters/pauses during the first two early ingame cut scenes, ie audio is fine but drawing of the scene stops/hiccups/stutters). Gameplay, movements and game controls  etc all work.
systemInfoNotes: Actually used 3.7.6 to test this due to comments regarding 3.7.5 not working

title: Crysis

notes: Install Crysis 64-bit binaries (https://community.pcgamingwiki.com/files/file/257-crysis-64-bit-binaries/) and disable Esync and D3D11 via launch options. The game seems to run well enough, though various lighting effects do not render properly.
